summary: Explore the diverse wonders of the Sn√¶fellsnes Peninsula, often called 'Iceland in Miniature.' From dramatic black pebble beaches and coastal hiking paths to underground lava tubes and intimate hot springs, this day showcases the peninsula's incredible variety of landscapes. End your day with a golden hour drive to Akranes, completing your clockwise journey around Iceland's Ring Road.

schedule.title: Dj√∫pal√≥nssandur Black Pebble Beach
schedule.description: Explore this dramatic beach with its smooth black pebbles, shipwreck remains, and unique rock formations. The beach was once home to fishing stations, and you can still see the lifting stones used to test fishermen's strength.

schedule.title: Hellnar to Arnarstapi Coastal Path
schedule.description: Enjoy a spectacular 2.5-mile coastal hike between these two charming villages. The trail offers stunning views of lava formations, sea arches, and nesting birds. The path is well-maintained but includes some uneven terrain.

schedule.title: Vatnshellir Cave Tour
schedule.description: Descend 35 meters below the surface into an 8,000-year-old lava tube. This guided tour takes you through fascinating underground formations and explains the volcanic forces that created them. Helmets and lights are provided.

schedule.title: Ytri Tunga Beach (Seal Colony)
schedule.description: Visit this golden sand beach, one of the few non-black beaches in Iceland and home to a colony of harbor seals. Best seal viewing is at low tide when they gather on the rocks offshore.

schedule.title: Lanbrotalaug Hot Spring
schedule.description: Enjoy a soak in this tiny natural hot pot with mountain views. The spring fits only 2-3 people, making it an intimate experience away from crowds. The temperature is perfect for relaxation.

schedule.title: Ger√∞uberg Basalt Columns
schedule.description: Marvel at this symmetrical wall of hexagonal basalt columns, stretching along a hillside for about 1 km. The uniform columns were created by slow cooling of liquid lava, resulting in this spectacular natural formation.

tip: If visiting Lanbrotalaug hot spring, bring your own towel and prepare to change in your car, as there are no facilities. For the Hellnar to Arnarstapi hike, you can leave your car at either end and hike one-way, then take the public bus back (summer only) or hitchhike, which is common practice and generally safe in Iceland.
notes: The Sn√¶fellsnes Peninsula is where Jules Verne set the entrance to the center of the Earth in his novel 'Journey to the Center of the Earth.' The Vatnshellir Cave tour should be booked in advance, especially during high season. If time runs short, prioritize activities at the western end of the peninsula (Dj√∫pal√≥nssandur, Arnarstapi) as they're more unique to this region.
